meanings.definition: A person who is incompetent or inept at a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The new recruits were complete duffers when it came to assembling the equipment.
meanings.sent2: The duffers in the group struggled to follow the dance steps.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, the duffers couldn't even boil an egg without burning it.
meanings.sent4: In a team of skilled players, he stood out like a duffer on the golf course.
meanings.sent5: The duffers' attempts at painting the fence left it looking like a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'duffer', referring to multiple individuals who are inept or incompetent.
meanings.sent1: The duffers gathered at the park, each one more clueless than the next.
meanings.sent2: When the duffers tried to fix the leak, they only made it worse.
meanings.sent3: The duffers' cooking competition turned into a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: The group of duffers resembled a flock of lost sheep in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: Their team of duffers was like a comedy show, always messing things up.
